page.title: 06BROADBAY SOUTH - STEINISH
page.content: The village of Steinish has approximately 30 houses. The oldest house was built in 1920. There are 14 crofts. Some are unused but most have sheep and a few cows. Some croft land is cultivated. The present population is approximately 100. Employment is mostly found in the Stornoway area. There is one weaver operating a Harris Tweed loom. The only real business is a nursery which sells flowers, plants and eggs. There are no shops in the village although a grocery van comes round once a week. The nearest shop is in Plasterfield about 1km away.
